subject: (3.8) ComparisonFailure output format choice
msgSnippet: Is there an option in junit 3.8.1 to get context from getMessage in junit.framework.ComparisonFailure, more similar to the pre-3.8 situation?     I haven t
messageBody:
Is there an option in junit 3.8.1 to get context from getMessage in
junit.framework.ComparisonFailure, more similar to the pre-3.8
situation? I haven't found one. I don't at all like the new
output format, with "..." replacing initial and final parts of the
text that are equal between the "expected" and "found" values.
There's no context at all! This makes it take more time or effort to
identify the offending input text, and the offending characters within
the offending text. What if the test complains about <...X...> and I
have 20 Xes in my text? Now I can't tell which one indicates the
problem. Also, I can no longer use the full text as a quick clue to
the particular test that's complaining. It would already be an
improvement to include, say, 10 characters of context on either side
of the part that differs between the "expected" and "found" values.
It would be even better if users could select how much context they
get, to satisfy both those who prefer getting all context over getting
none (like myself) and those who prefer getting none over getting all
(like the people who recommended the use of the current ... mechanism).

Best regards,

Louis Strous
